newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Ivory Coast 96/97 export licences agreed.
newsitem.headline: Ivory Coast 96/97 export licences agreed.

text.p: Ivory Coast's government has drawn up a list of approved exporters for its 1996/97 cocoa marketing season which opened on October 24, said a Caistab source on Wednesday.
"The list has been agreed but must be signed by a minister," the source from the Ivorian cocoa and coffee marketing board added.
The list was expected to be available by the end of this week or early next week, the source said.
Shipping sources said the list had been agreed and they expected to have copies detailing which companies had been approved soon.
"We should see the full list tomorrow or at least within a few days," said the shipping source.

Approval of exporters has been put off since the beginning of the season and some exporters were not shipping cocoa as banks were requesting licences and backing contracts before releasing finance for exporters and their buyers.
About 31 are expected to receive licences but some exporters told Reuters last month they expected two or three licences given in 1995/96 to be revoked.
